rawContent:
"Charles Breyer signed a release order on the bench, having been assured by the government that it was their expectation that the Department of Homeland Security would move immediately to detain and deport her."

Another San Francisco drug dealer deported by the Feds.

user.rawDescription: Shining a light on violent crime in the city. Contact: editor@sfpublicsafety.news

quotedTweet.rawContent:
A young Honduran drug dealer was sentenced today in San Francisco federal court under a fast track scheme designed rapidly to arrest, convict and deport lower-level drug offenders who are foreign nationals.

Candy Celeste Cardona-Zuniga, 18, was arrested by DEA agents on August 8 having been covertly observed making ‘hand to hand’ drug transactions in the Tenderloin. She was found in possession of 148 grams of fentanyl and 52 grams of heroin.

She was sentenced to a ‘time served’ sentence of 28 days. U.S. District Judge Charles Breyer signed a release order on the bench having been assured by the government that it was their expectation that the Department of Homeland Security would move immediately to detain and deport her.

“This disposition results in a drug trafficking conviction within weeks of arrest (not months or years), immediate separation of the defendant from the Tenderloin, and prevention of the defendant from returning to the Tenderloin,” said Assistant U.S. Attorney Dan Karmel in a sentencing memorandum.

“The speed at which this case moved will free up other government resources to prosecute additional federal crimes, including in the Tenderloin.”

Full story: https://t.co/AoO7dvr0KQ

rawContent:
He’s on Trial for Rape

He dont do de English 

He’s from Dominican Republic 

Why is even here?

Deport him 

If you want to see a change please give us a follow, give us a retweet , you’re not following a person or a political party, the only aim Atm is to get foreign criminals deported  

Getting the petition signed by as many people as possible.  (Once the government finish checking it)is our priority 

I doubt the petition is going to make them do anything but when it’s signed by enough people we will have a mandate. 
Support gives us the green light for direct action  

Wording of Petition below

Imprisoned Foreign criminals deported and never to be released back into 🇬🇧

Foreign Nationals including Asylum Seekers and Uk Passport holders with dual citizenship or previous Asylum Claims, who are sentenced to imprisonment of 12mths or over to be mandatorily deported unless otherwise ordered by the sentencing judge, if not done by EDR then held in secure accommodation

The sentencing judge will be in possession of pre sentence reports etc and is the best placed person to make a decision on deportation, the deportation decision is not appealable, this doesn’t preclude any other appeal based around the conviction and sentence. In the instance of UKBA 2007 sec 33(2) if the deportee wishes to appeal on these grounds, the appellant must be held in secure accommodation until the decision is made, no appeal can be launched until the EDR has been reached
